column4: hey guys i am new to linux and have a question and I wonder if you can help me.....i have ubuntu but 2 friends and a few articles i read said that unity is not as secure as gnome so I google "gnome vs unity on privacy, safety and security" and then I notice on distrowatch when I do a search for security or privacy or fire wall they all have gnome or I386 ....so why did ubuntu moved away from gnome?
and can i turn my ubuntu 11.10 into gnome?
so the articles I read on google on unity vs gnome are wrong?
unity is a shell for gnome, but it is not gnome-shell (which is what people typically think of when referring to gnome 3)
